tweets.text: “Build on flood plains despite the risks, said govt advisers in 2016 ... Most of the UK’s properties are supposed to be automatically protected from flood risk under a system known as Flood Re, an arrangement between the govt and the insurance industry” https://t.co/vioITKF7FU

It’s been a fairly dry night (Thursday) across the #Midlands but we still have lots of #flood alerts & warnings and river levels are still rising. Please keep checking your #flood risk. Latest info here…

#StormChristoph #PrepareActSurvive

https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/HfgDD7V5BO

There are close to 30 flood warnings across #Herefordshire and #Worcestershire this morning.

River levels have now peaked in some areas, but @EnvAgencyMids says water is still rising on the Severn, with peaks in Worcestershire not being reached until the weekend. https://t.co/JcXvftAnK2

tweets.text: No need to go to Venice, come to Shrewsbury, now floods twice a year! And us residents are left to deal with this & sewerage spilling out from sinks & loos @ShropCouncil @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency @DKShrewsbury flood #17 since I998 and nothing has changed https://t.co/IZl7ACEVqz

tweets.text: Today Prime Minister @BorisJohnson visited Didsbury to see how the @EnvAgency and the emergency services are working with local and national government to defend against flooding and support those who might be affected. https://t.co/8U8rHrhdZv

tweets.text: So here we are again, flood #17 since 1998 #Shrewsbury not even a year since double flood of Feb2020, said then it would be yesterday's fish & chip paper, until the next flood. 21 years & @ShropCouncil @EnvAgency @BorisJohnson @MPGeorgeEustice PFR scheme is not fit for purpose https://t.co/lTxeP38Cps

tweets.text:
The weather has improved, but river levels are still high and @EnvAgency Flood Alerts remain in place in some parts of the River Don (Kirk Bramwith, Stainforth and Fishlake). 

The River Don continues to over-top near Stainforth spilling into wash lands, as it is designed to do. https://t.co/vvaAdFyb40

tweets.text:
A local paper this week said we don't defend #Kent from flooding. Not so. 

We're out all the time clearing blockages, like today: 

#IsleofSheppey, #EastPeckham, and we saw a superb rainbow at #FiveOakGreen.

Please report river debris: 0800 807060
Pix: @DeTom48 
#floodaware https://t.co/0KSBbzi7tU

Shame @NatalieElphicke (salary paid for by the tax-payer) who is supposed to represent her constituents doesn’t have the courtesy to open up her tweets for comment. Is it because she knows she will be held accountable the worst constituency MP (after her criminal husband)? https://t.co/AuAeZggqhF

tweets.text:
RT @BorisJohnson: In Didsbury today I saw the brilliant work the @EnvAgency and emergency services are doing to defend the area from flooding.

If you think your home may be at risk of flooding, please follow the advice and be prepared: … https://t.co/BywuqQG5oL

tweets.text: @GHR_WestYorks @EnvAgencyYNE Hi, I'm a producer with Sky News in London. Could we please use your video and give you on-screen credit?

domain.name: Brand
domain.description: Brands and Companies

tweets.text:
Here's the latest from #Northwich, where the flood defences are holding river water back. 

There a lot of some surface water around at the moment and we are working closely with @Go_CheshireWest and @Unitedutilities to try and get the water back into the river. https://t.co/fkTYBjr9lB

We are aware of intermittent issues with the forecasted river level data showing online for the #Willington & #Shardlow gauges. Please be assured the current river level data is accurate & our Flood Warning Service messages are unaffected. Check your risk: https://t.co/yAGmLmHGAa https://t.co/T5WpfiAI4Q

@EnvAgency @ShropCouncil @DaveThroupEA @TelfordWrekin These pictures from @SFRS_cjackson show the extent of flooding in Shrewsbury overnight. Fire crews are urging people not to drive into flood water #HeartNews https://t.co/gITYDgPk8X

There are #FloodWarnings in place as #StormChristoph brings heavy rain across England.  

Know what to do in a flood and check your flood risk: https://t.co/MPz7Fwblnq  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/MaE7ptFod2

@EnvAgency @ShropCouncil @DaveThroupEA It's as @TelfordWrekin confirm Coalbrookdale and Ironbridge Primary School will be closed today. Sandbags have been delivered to at-risk properties #HeartNews https://t.co/CL2pZNhsUq

tweets.text: Ecosystems services water storage and flood mitigation using the natural flood plain @EnvAgency funded work planned and implemented by @WiganCouncil in partnership with @Lancswildlife https://t.co/XGuz5PDA37

3 SEVERE Flood Warnings remain on the River Dee this morning. 195 Flood Warnings across the rest of England and Wales @EnvAgency @NatResWales 

The flood risk will continue into the weekend, even though the worst of the rain is over. Latest flood warnings: https://t.co/dMe1MtLefD https://t.co/nAmng9Muqs

Well done Greg. This must be stopped. We found out yesterday that the water discharge permit issued by the @EnvAgency to HS2 allows quality 10 times worse than other river dischargers. Up to 10 million litres per day. https://t.co/B8280nniCa

tweets.text: As conditions improve, levels on the #Don remain high but are back within the riverbank. We’re working with @MyDoncaster and local flood wardens and have pumps at #Fishlake should they be needed. Our teams continue to inspect the river and washlands through the night. https://t.co/JJvuKkHr2n

@EdCTBrown @EnvAgency Point is the ea is a shambles and the farmer has sown field in correct direction notill could prob solve this and the ea guy has a cheek to pic holes in other people work when there not doing there own

@DuncanTWilson @hortijames @agricontract @EnvAgency I think a minimum 18m margin is a start. Like your tramline idea if you could get something established quick. I’m looking at planting potato companions between the rows to try and build in some stability. The of course there’s what you do across the rest of the rotation

tweets.text: @LoucresswellEA @EnvAgencyMids @PaulReevesEA Sat at home tonight monitoring levels and working with our field teams to ensure the pumping can continue 24/7 as required in these areas. Great to have such an enthusiastic committed team out on site!

Update from @Derbyshirecc this morning (Friday). Latest flood information here as well - #StormChristoph 

https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/PM4icLhm7U

tweets.text: Flooding in Dallam means a number of residents remain cut off, @CheshireFire and @manchesterfire using boats to access vulnerable and elderly.  @WarringtonBC have opened rest centre for anyone evacuated. Please continue to monitor @EnvAgencyNW as water levels remain high. https://t.co/QLi3yq8Cpm
